meanings.definition: A defended position on a beach taken from the enemy by landing forces.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers held the beachhead against the enemy attack.
meanings.sent2: The army established a beachhead to secure the area.
meanings.sent3: The beachhead was so well defended, even the seagulls couldn't get through!
meanings.sent4: The beachhead became a fortress of safety amidst the crashing waves of battle.
meanings.sent5: The image of the beachhead, with its flags waving proudly, stayed in their minds.

meanings.definition: A secure initial position that has been established.
meanings.sent1: The team set up a beachhead in the new market to start their business.
meanings.sent2: After much planning, they finally had a beachhead to launch their project.
meanings.sent3: The beachhead in the park was their secret spot for picnics and fun.
meanings.sent4: Their beachhead in the neighborhood quickly became the go-to place for gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The beachhead of their friendship was the shared love for music and laughter.
